1.html:
From the root of the project, run:

Easy method:

./scripts/client.sh

Manual method:

pnpm i && pnpm dev

The client requires environment variables to be set. See the Environment Variables page for more information.

8.html: The useDojo hook is a core part of the Dojo framework that provides access to essential game functionality, account management, and network interactions.
8.text:
The useDojo hook is a core part of the Dojo framework that provides access to essential game functionality, account
management, and network interactions.
8.title: useDojo Hook

9.html:
import { useDojo } from "@/hooks/context/DojoContext";
function GameComponent() {
  const { account, network, masterAccount } = useDojo();
  // ... your game logic
}
9.title: Usage

11.html:
The hook provides comprehensive wallet and account management capabilities:

  • Burner Wallet Creation: Create temporary wallets for players
  • Account Selection: Switch between different burner wallets
  • Account Listing: View all available burner wallets
  • Master Account Access: Access to the game's master account
  • Deployment Status: Track wallet deployment status
11.text:
The hook provides comprehensive wallet and account management capabilities:

Burner Wallet Creation: Create temporary wallets for players
Account Selection: Switch between different burner wallets
Account Listing: View all available burner wallets
Master Account Access: Access to the game's master account
Deployment Status: Track wallet deployment status
11.title: Account Management

12.html: Access to network configuration and setup results for interacting with the Starknet blockchain.
12.text: Access to network configuration and setup results for interacting with the Starknet blockchain.
12.title: Network Integration

13.html: Provides access to all initialized game systems, components, and world configurations.
13.text: Provides access to all initialized game systems, components, and world configurations.
13.title: Game Setup

14.html:
The hook must be used within a DojoProvider component and requires the following environment variables:

  • VITE_PUBLIC_MASTER_ADDRESS
  • VITE_PUBLIC_MASTER_PRIVATE_KEY
  • VITE_PUBLIC_ACCOUNT_CLASS_HASH
14.text:
The hook must be used within a DojoProvider component and requires the following environment variables:

VITE_PUBLIC_MASTER_ADDRESS
VITE_PUBLIC_MASTER_PRIVATE_KEY
VITE_PUBLIC_ACCOUNT_CLASS_HASH
14.title: Requirements

15.html:
The hook returns an object containing:

  • setup: Complete Dojo context including game systems and components
  • account: Account management functions and state
  • network: Network configuration and setup results
  • masterAccount: The master account instance
15.text:
The hook returns an object containing:

setup: Complete Dojo context including game systems and components
account: Account management functions and state
network: Network configuration and setup results
masterAccount: The master account instance
15.title: Return Value

16.html:
function GameUI() {
  const { account } = useDojo();
  return (
    <div>
      <p>Current Account: {account.account.address}</p>
    </div>
  );
}
16.title: Example

17.html: Wrapper around the DojoProvider, which itself is a wrapper around a generic Starknet provider, an API to easy interact with your contract’s API via the RPC. Each layer of abstraction adds its own set of functionalities, with the Eternum Provider mainly providing easy access to all the system calls that our systems expose (create_army, etc…)
17.text:
Wrapper around the DojoProvider, which itself is a wrapper around a generic Starknet provider, an API to easy interact
with your contract’s API via the RPC. Each layer of abstraction adds its own set of functionalities, with the Eternum
Provider mainly providing easy access to all the system calls that our systems expose (create_army, etc…)
17.title: Eternum provider

18.html: You can use offchain messages to store information in the indexer, but it is not persisted onchain. Some examples of use cases for this are in-game messages. Refer to this code for an example of how to use offchain messages

this code

18.title: Offchain messages

19.html:
Recs allow you to query the state of the world and subscribe to changes in the world. It is the recommended way to manage state in the client.

const structureAtPosition = runQuery([HasValue(Position, { x, y }), Has(Structure)]);

This line of code will run a query against the local state of the browser and return all the structures that are at the position { x, y }. This does not execute any call to Torii as the local state is already synced with the latest updates.

This part of the code in client/src/dojo/setup.ts is where the local state is initialized and synced.
19.text:
Recs allow you to query the state of the world and subscribe to changes in the world. It is the recommended way to
manage state in the client.
const structureAtPosition = runQuery([HasValue(Position, { x, y }), Has(Structure)]);
This line of code will run a query against the local state of the browser and return all the structures that are at the
position { x, y }. This does not execute any call to Torii as the local state is already synced with the latest
updates.
This part of the code in client/src/dojo/setup.ts is where the local state is initialized and synced.
19.title: State Management with Recs

20.html:
To subscribe to changes in the world, you can use the useEntityQuery hook. This hook will return the entity that matches the query and update it if it changes.

const allRealms = useEntityQuery([Has(Realm)]);
20.title: Subscribing to changes

21.html:
After you have run a query, you can get the value of your components using the getComponentValue function.

const realm = getComponentValue(Realm, entityId);

The entityId is the poseidon hash of all the keys of the component you want to get. This can be an easier way to get your component than using a query if you already know all the keys.
21.text:
After you have run a query, you can get the value of your components using the getComponentValue function.
const realm = getComponentValue(Realm, entityId);
The entityId is the poseidon hash of all the keys of the component you want to get. This can be an easier way to get
your component than using a query if you already know all the keys.
21.title: Getting the value of your components

22.html:
If you have an entityId, you can get a component from it using the getComponent function.

const realm = getComponentValue(Realm, getEntityIdFromKeys([entityId]));

The previous line of code is equivalent to:

const entity = runQuery([Has(Realm), HasValue(Keys, [entityId])]);
const realm = getComponentValue(Realm, Array.from(entity)[0]);
22.title: Getting a component from an entity
titles: Getting the value of your components

24.html: You will need to add your component to the contractComponents.ts file. This will ensure that the component is synced with the state of the world and will provide the types for the component.
24.text:
You will need to add your component to the contractComponents.ts file. This will ensure that the component is synced
with the state of the world and will provide the types for the component.
24.title: Adding a new component

25.html: You will need to add your system logic to the sdk/packages/eternum/src/provider/index.ts file and then use it in the createSystemCalls.ts file. This will ensure that the system is called with the correct arguments and will provide the types for the system.
25.text:
You will need to add your system logic to the sdk/packages/eternum/src/provider/index.ts file and then use it in the
createSystemCalls.ts file. This will ensure that the system is called with the correct arguments and will provide the
types for the system.
25.title: Adding a new system

26.html:
You can use optimistic updates to update the local state without waiting for the transaction to be included in a block. This is useful to provide a better user experience by updating the UI immediately.

private _optimisticDestroy = (entityId: ID, col: number, row: number) => {
	const overrideId = uuid();
	const realmPosition = getComponentValue(this.setup.components.Position, getEntityIdFromKeys([BigInt(entityId)]));
	const { x: outercol, y: outerrow } = realmPosition || { x: 0, y: 0 };
	const entity = getEntityIdFromKeys([outercol, outerrow, col, row].map((v) => BigInt(v)));
	this.setup.components.Building.addOverride(overrideId, {
		entity,
		value: {
		outer_col: outercol,
		outer_row: outerrow,
		inner_col: col,
		inner_row: row,
		category: "None",
		produced_resource_type: 0,
		bonus_percent: 0,
		entity_id: 0,
		outer_entity_id: 0,
		},
	});
	return overrideId;
};

You can use the uuid function to generate a unique overrideId. Remember to return the overrideId so you can later delete it after the transaction is included in a block. It's good practice to remove the override, however because of a delay between the transaction being included in a block and Torii syncing, you might have a split second where the override is removed and the Recs being updated. This will cause your component (i.e. a building) to appear then disappear for a second before reappearing.
26.title: Optimistic updates

28.html:
• Note that every field you add in a model will raise the storage cost of each transaction that modifies the model.
  • Try to make models as small as possible, and re-use existing models as much as possible, every model and system that you add raises the size of the CASM, and there is a limit to the size of a declared contract on Starknet.
  • Keep systems stateless. Store your game state in models.
  • When implementing a new game logic, you will need to keep in mind that the game already has physics implemented, such as weight, position, movement, speed, etc. If creating something that needs to have any of this logic, re-use components so everything stays logical.
28.text:
Note that every field you add in a model will raise the storage cost of each transaction that modifies the model.
Try to make models as small as possible, and re-use existing models as much as possible, every model and system that
you add raises the size of the CASM, and there is a limit to the size of a declared contract on Starknet.
Keep systems stateless. Store your game state in models.
When implementing a new game logic, you will need to keep in mind that the game already has physics implemented, such
as weight, position, movement, speed, etc. If creating something that needs to have any of this logic, re-use
components so everything stays logical.
28.title: Rules of thumb

30.html: Use the ID type alias for keys that require a unique identifier.
30.text: Use the ID type alias for keys that require a unique identifier.
30.title: Keys

32.html:
Where possible make traits for the models so they are stateless for unit testing.

Always use generate trait where possible to minimise code.

#[generate_trait]
32.text:
Where possible make traits for the models so they are stateless for unit testing.

#[generate_trait]
32.title: Implementations

33.html:
#[derive(Copy, Drop, Serde)]
#[dojo::model]
pub struct Structure {
    #[key]
    entity_id: ID,
    category: StructureCategory,
    created_at: u64
}

To test this model, you need to add it to the contracts/src/utils/testing/world.cairo file so it can be instantiated in the tests.

34.html:
If you need some data to be available in the client, but it doesn't need to be stored onchain, you can use an event model.

#[derive(Introspect, Copy, Drop, Serde)]
#[dojo::event]
#[dojo::model]
pub struct ExampleEvent {
    #[key]
    id: ID,
    #[key]
    event_id: EventType,
	my_data_field: u8
}
34.text:
If you need some data to be available in the client, but it doesn't need to be stored onchain, you can use an event
model.
#[derive(Introspect, Copy, Drop, Serde)]
#[dojo::event]
#[dojo::model]
pub struct ExampleEvent {
    #[key]
    id: ID,
    #[key]
    event_id: EventType,
	my_data_field: u8
}
34.title: Event models

35.html:
Design systems like this in the directory

  • SystemName
    • system_name.cairo
    • tests.cairo

system.cairo should include the implementation of the system like this.

Things to note:

  • Interface at top of File
  • use of super::IBuildingContract to minimise imports and make it clear where the interface is defined.
#[dojo::interface]
trait IBuildingContract<TContractState> {
    fn create(
        entity_id: ID,
        building_coord: s0_eternum::models::position::Coord,
        building_category: s0_eternum::models::buildings::BuildingCategory,
        produce_resource_type: Option<u8>
    );
}
 
#[dojo::contract]
mod building_systems {
    use s0_eternum::alias::ID;
    use s0_eternum::models::{
        resources::{Resource, ResourceCost}, owner::Owner, hyperstructure::HyperStructure,
        order::Orders, position::{Coord, Position, PositionTrait, Direction},
        buildings::{BuildingCategory, Building, BuildingImpl},
        production::{Production, ProductionRateTrait}, realm::{Realm, RealmImpl}
    };
 
    #[abi(embed_v0)]
    impl BuildingContractImpl of super::IBuildingContract<ContractState> {
        fn create(
            world: IWorldDispatcher,
            entity_id: ID,
            building_coord: Coord,
            building_category: BuildingCategory,
            produce_resource_type: Option<u8>,
        ) {
        }
    }
}

To test this system, you need to add it to the contracts/src/utils/testing/world.cairo file so it can be instantiated in the tests.
35.title: Adding a system

38.html:
Install dojo via

curl -L https://install.dojoengine.org | bash

Make sure install the same version within the Scarb.toml file.

Eternum uses a pnpm workspace and bun for scripts to allow easy npm packages to be created. So you will need pnpm installed also.

npm install -g pnpm

Make sure install the same version within the Scarb.toml file.

sh scripts/client.sh

43.html:
For local development, create a file called .env.local in the client repository and add the following:

VITE_PUBLIC_MASTER_ADDRESS="0x127fd5f1fe78a71f8bcd1fec63e3fe2f0486b6ecd5c86a0466c3a21fa5cfcec"
VITE_PUBLIC_MASTER_PRIVATE_KEY="0xc5b2fcab997346f3ea1c00b002ecf6f382c5f9c9659a3894eb783c5320f912"
VITE_PUBLIC_WORLD_ADDRESS="0x320b2713e324fe3125bbc42d85ff69cb3c0908b436fa38a35746dbc45deeb11"
VITE_PUBLIC_ACCOUNT_CLASS_HASH="0x07dc7899aa655b0aae51eadff6d801a58e97dd99cf4666ee59e704249e51adf2"
VITE_NETWORK_FEE_TOKEN="0x49d36570d4e46f48e99674bd3fcc84644ddd6b96f7c741b1562b82f9e004dc7"
VITE_EVENT_KEY="0x1a2f334228cee715f1f0f54053bb6b5eac54fa336e0bc1aacf7516decb0471d"
VITE_PUBLIC_TORII="http://localhost:8080"
VITE_TORII_GRAPHQL="http://localhost:8080/graphql"
VITE_TORII_WS="ws://localhost:8080/graphql/ws"
VITE_PUBLIC_NODE_URL="http://localhost:5050/"
VITE_PUBLIC_DEV=true
VITE_PUBLIC_SHOW_FPS=true
VITE_PUBLIC_GRAPHICS_DEV=false
VITE_PUBLIC_TORII_RELAY="/ip4/127.0.0.1/tcp/9092/ws"

This file is subject to change, please keep an eye on the repository for potential updates.
43.title: Environment Variables

44.html:
• Contracts: built using the Dojo framework. This leverages the ECS model, allowing us to build quick and ship fast. It revolves around 3 units: Entities, Components (called Models in Dojo) and Systems (more about this in the Dojo book).
  • Client: our client is built using React with Typescript. We leverage Dojo by using DojoJS
  • Eternum SDK: our SDK contains most notably the getter and setter of the configuration of Eternum, the EternumProvider and most of the constants/types of the world that needed to be transcribed to Typescript.
  • Torii: Dojo's indexer, optimized for that particular framework and well integrated into the stack. From our client, we have a gRPC subscription set up through DojoJS and recs to events. Events are fired in the contracts as a way for the indexer to know what's going on in the world. Every time an entity is created, updated, or deleted, an event is fired which updated Torii's record of the world.
  • DojoJS and recs: DojoJS is the SDK that allows easy integration of a Dojo app into your client/node backend. Recs are DojoJS's way of exposing the state of the world to the client. This is done via queries to the Recs state using a simple query language, which doesn't support complex queries yet (e.g. joins, gt, lt, etc...).
44.text:
Contracts: built using the Dojo framework. This leverages the ECS model, allowing us to
build quick and ship fast. It revolves around 3 units: Entities, Components (called Models in Dojo) and Systems (more
about this in the Dojo book).
Client: our client is built using React with Typescript. We leverage Dojo by using DojoJS
Eternum SDK: our SDK contains most notably the getter and setter of the configuration of Eternum,
the EternumProvider and most of the constants/types of the world that needed to be transcribed to Typescript.
Torii: Dojo's indexer, optimized for that particular framework and well
integrated into the stack. From our client, we have a gRPC subscription set up through DojoJS and recs to events.
Events are fired in the contracts as a way for the indexer to know what's going on in the world. Every time an entity
is created, updated, or deleted, an event is fired which updated Torii's record of the world.
DojoJS and recs: DojoJS is the SDK
that allows easy integration of a Dojo app into your client/node backend. Recs are DojoJS's way of exposing the state
of the world to the client. This is done via queries to the Recs state using a simple query language, which doesn't
support complex queries yet (e.g. joins, gt, lt, etc...).
44.title: Stack

48.html:
This SDK contains most notably the getter and setter of the configuration of Eternum, the EternumProvider and most of the constants/types of the world that needed to be transcribed to Typescript.

Everything considered as client agnostic should be in there. The main reason for this separation is to be able to re-use this logic in any other project that uses Typescript, e.g. new mobile client, data analytics app, etc.
48.text:
This SDK contains most notably the getter and setter of the configuration of Eternum, the EternumProvider and most of
the constants/types of the world that needed to be transcribed to Typescript.
Everything considered as client agnostic should be in there. The main reason for this separation is to be able to re-use
this logic in any other project that uses Typescript, e.g. new mobile client, data analytics app, etc.
48.title: Structure

50.html: Achievements are a lasting testament to your accomplishments across all seasons, awarded for completing specific in-game objectives. Players earn achievements through the Cartridge Controller, with requirements accessible by clicking on their controller name. Completing achievements earns points, allowing players to compete for positions on the achievement leaderboard.
50.text:
Achievements are a lasting testament to your accomplishments across all seasons, awarded for completing specific in-game
objectives. Players earn achievements through the Cartridge Controller, with requirements accessible by clicking on
their controller name. Completing achievements earns points, allowing players to compete for positions on the
achievement leaderboard.
50.title: Cartridge Achievements

53.html: Everything in the Eternum revolves around an Eternum Day. Each Eternum Day is 60 minutes long. The hourglass timer displays the percentage of the day that has passed.
53.text:
Everything in the Eternum revolves around an Eternum Day. Each Eternum Day is 60 minutes long. The hourglass timer
displays the percentage of the day that has passed.
53.title: ⏳ Time Cycle

54.html: Explore the Eternum World Map to search for realms, significant structures, and strategize battles. Armies can traverse through hexes that have already been discovered or venture into unexplored ones. Their stamina is partially replenished each Eternum Day.
54.text:
Explore the Eternum World Map to search for realms, significant structures, and strategize battles. Armies can traverse
through hexes that have already been discovered or venture into unexplored ones. Their stamina is partially replenished
each Eternum Day.
54.title: 🌎 World Map

55.html:
Resources are produced by buildings in a realm. Most production chains require input resources to generate output resources.

Maintaining a balanced production is key to sustaining your realm's economy. If there are insufficient resources or storage capacity, production automatically stops, but input resources continue to be consumed until paused.
55.text:
Resources are produced by buildings in a realm. Most production chains require input resources to generate output
resources.
Maintaining a balanced production is key to sustaining your realm's economy. If there are insufficient resources or
storage capacity, production automatically stops, but input resources continue to be consumed until paused.
55.title: 💎 Resource Production

56.html:
Trading is the backbone of the economy in Eternum. The Lords Market is a central marketplace where players can buy and sell resources to each other.

Trades are facilitated via donkeys and the cost depends on the weight of the resources being transported. Donkeys are required for all trades.
56.text:
Trading is the backbone of the economy in Eternum. The Lords Market is a central marketplace where players can buy and
sell resources to each other.
Trades are facilitated via donkeys and the cost depends on the weight of the resources being transported. Donkeys are
required for all trades.
56.title: 🤝 Trading

57.html:
Hyperstructures are the key to ruling Eternum. Build and contribute to them and earn valuable Victory Points (VP).

Hyperstructures are built using Ancient Fragments that can only be obtained through Fragment Mines scattered around the map.

Once a player reaches the required seasons VP they will be able to end the season and claim victory!
57.text:
Hyperstructures are the key to ruling Eternum. Build and contribute to them and earn valuable Victory Points (VP).
Hyperstructures are built using Ancient Fragments that can only be obtained through Fragment Mines scattered around the
map.
Once a player reaches the required seasons VP they will be able to end the season and claim victory!
57.title: 🏛️ Hyperstructures

58.html: Tribes are player-formed social organizations in Eternum that enable cooperation and coordination. Anyone can join public tribes. Private tribes are by invitation-only.
58.text:
Tribes are player-formed social organizations in Eternum that enable cooperation and coordination. Anyone can join
public tribes. Private tribes are by invitation-only.
58.title: 👥 Tribes

60.html:
• Trade resources with other players
  • All trades require donkeys for transport
  • Resources have weight that affects transport capacity
  • Monitor market prices for optimal trading
60.text:
Trade resources with other players
All trades require donkeys for transport
Resources have weight that affects transport capacity
Monitor market prices for optimal trading
60.title: Order Book

62.html: The AMM enables players to swap resources for $LORDS and vice versa. Exchange rates are influenced by liquidity pools.
62.text:
The AMM enables players to swap resources for $LORDS and vice versa. Exchange rates are influenced by liquidity
pools.
62.title: Swaps

63.html: Players can provide liquidity by depositing resources and $LORDS into pools. This earns trading fees proportional to your share and helps maintain a stable trading environment, increasing overall market efficiency.
63.text:
Players can provide liquidity by depositing resources and $LORDS into pools. This earns trading fees proportional to
your share and helps maintain a stable trading environment, increasing overall market efficiency.
63.title: Liquidity Pools

64.html: Donkeys are essential for all resource transfers. Each donkey can carry up to 100kg, and transport time depends on the distance to its destination. It's important to consider transport costs in your trade calculations. Ensure your realm has the necessary resources for transportation.
64.text:
Donkeys are essential for all resource transfers. Each donkey can carry up to 100kg, and transport time depends on the
distance to its destination. It's important to consider transport costs in your trade calculations. Ensure your realm
has the necessary resources for transportation.
64.title: Transport

65.html:
To bridge resources, visit the Empires Bridge.

  • Sending Resources: When you want to send resources (like $LORDS) to another realm, the bridge calculates the distance and travel time based on the coordinates of your realm and the central bank. The transport time depends on the distance and is calculated as 14 seconds per kilometer.
  • Withdrawing Resources: To bridge resources out of the game, you must first travel from your realm to the central bank. This process is not instant, resources must physically "move" to the bank.
65.text:
To bridge resources, visit the Empires Bridge.

Sending Resources: When you want to send resources (like $LORDS) to another realm, the bridge calculates the
distance and travel time based on the coordinates of your realm and the central bank. The transport time depends on
the distance and is calculated as 14 seconds per kilometer.
Withdrawing Resources: To bridge resources out of the game, you must first travel from your realm to the central
bank. This process is not instant, resources must physically "move" to the bank.
65.title: Transporting Resources

66.html:
The Central Bank is a neutral structure, located at the center of the map, that controls the AMM and receives a part of its fees. The central bank acts as the hub for all bridging activities. Whether you’re sending resources to another realm or withdrawing them, everything must pass through the central bank first.

Anyone can claim it for themselves, but be wary, as it is protected by a significant defensive force.

When the Bank is being attacked, the AMM will be locked until the battle has ended.

Ownership Benefits:
  • Owner collects AMM trading fees, providing a significant source of passive income.
  • The bank can be attacked and claimed by other players, making it a strategic target.
66.text:
The Central Bank is a neutral structure, located at the center of the map, that controls the AMM and receives a part of
its fees. The central bank acts as the hub for all bridging activities. Whether you’re sending resources to another
realm or withdrawing them, everything must pass through the central bank first.
Anyone can claim it for themselves, but be wary, as it is protected by a significant defensive force.

When the Bank is being attacked, the AMM will be locked until the battle has ended.

Ownership Benefits:

Owner collects AMM trading fees, providing a significant source of passive income.
The bank can be attacked and claimed by other players, making it a strategic target.
66.title: 🏦 Central Bank

67.html:
💡 Strategy

  • Regularly monitor market prices
  • Factor in transport costs when calculating trade profits
  • Watch liquidity levels for better exchange rates
  • Ensure you have sufficient donkey capacity for efficient trading
67.text:
💡 Strategy

Regularly monitor market prices
Factor in transport costs when calculating trade profits
Watch liquidity levels for better exchange rates
Ensure you have sufficient donkey capacity for efficient trading
67.title: Trading Tips

68.html: Tribes are player-formed social organizations in Eternum that enable cooperation and coordination. Join public tribes or consider reaching out to 'invitation-only' tribes in the Realms Discord to join.
68.text:
Tribes are player-formed social organizations in Eternum that enable cooperation and coordination. Join public tribes or
consider reaching out to 'invitation-only' tribes in the Realms Discord to join.
68.title: 👥 Tribes

69.html:
🫂 Tribe System

  • Any player can create a tribe
  • Set tribe name and description
  • Two types of tribes:
    • Public: Anyone can join directly
    • Private: Requires an invitation to join
69.text:
🫂 Tribe System

Any player can create a tribe
Set tribe name and description
Two types of tribes:

Public: Anyone can join directly
Private: Requires an invitation to join
69.title: Formation & Membership

70.html:
🏗️ Current Features

  • Social coordination tool
  • Access to tribe-only Hyperstructure contributions

When Hyperstructure is set to tribe-only mode
70.text:
🏗️ Current Features

Social coordination tool
Access to tribe-only Hyperstructure contributions

When Hyperstructure is set to tribe-only mode
70.title: Functionality

71.html:
Eternum unfolds on an infinite, recursive hexagonal grid that scales with the player population.

Players spawn in concentric circles radiating from the map's center, ensuring optimal scalability.

Distance plays a crucial role, influencing trade and army movement through time-based constraints.
71.text:
Eternum unfolds on an infinite, recursive hexagonal grid that scales with the player population.
Players spawn in concentric circles radiating from the map's center, ensuring optimal scalability.
Distance plays a crucial role, influencing trade and army movement through time-based constraints.
71.title: 🌎 World Map

72.html:
Armies can traverse through hexes that have already been discovered or venture into unexplored ones. This movement consumes energy and depletes food supplies from their realm.

During exploration, armies have the opportunity to obtain random resources.

Additionally, there is a small chance of discovering a Fragment mine.
72.text:
Armies can traverse through hexes that have already been discovered or venture into unexplored ones. This movement
consumes energy and depletes food supplies from their realm.
During exploration, armies have the opportunity to obtain random resources.
Additionally, there is a small chance of discovering a Fragment mine.
72.title: Travel & Exploration

73.html:
Fragment mines are the only source of Ancient Fragments and are found through exploration. When a mine is discovered, there is:

  • No immunity period
  • No siege period

Each mine is defended by a random number of bandits that must be defeated to claim the mine.

Mines have a fixed total capacity of Ancient Fragments and cannot produce more once depleted.

Production
  • Automatic production once claimed
  • No input resources required
  • Produces until reaching total capacity
  • Cannot be replenished once depleted
Combat Strategy

When a mine is under attack:

  • Players can join either side
  • Option to aid bandits against other players

there is: 

No immunity period
No siege period

Each mine is defended by a random number of bandits that must be defeated to claim the mine.
Mines have a fixed total capacity of Ancient Fragments and cannot produce more once depleted.
Production


Automatic production once claimed
No input resources required
Produces until reaching total capacity
Cannot be replenished once depleted


Combat Strategy

When a mine is under attack:

Players can join either side

⚔️ Key Points

  • Central Bank: Controls AMM trading fees
  • Fragment Mines: Required for Hyperstructures

75.html: The Cartridge Controller is a gaming-focused smart contract wallet that makes Web3 gaming accessible and transactionless via Session Keys. You must have a controller to play Eternum. To find out more about the controller, read their documentation here.
75.text:
The Cartridge Controller is a gaming-focused smart contract wallet that makes Web3 gaming accessible and transactionless
via Session Keys. You must have a controller to play Eternum. To find out more about the controller, read their
documentation here.
75.title: Cartridge Controller

76.html:
To use Season Passes and $LORDS, you will need to transfer them from your ArgentX or Braavos wallet to your controller.

To use the controller, you can either log in or sign up when starting Eternum. To create a controller, simply input a username and sign up.

You will then be prompted to set up a Passkey and PIN password. Once this is complete, you will be able to 'Create Session'. This enables all of the game functions in a transactionless session.
76.text:
To use Season Passes and $LORDS, you will need to transfer them from your ArgentX or Braavos wallet to your
controller.
To use the controller, you can either log in or sign up when starting Eternum. To create a controller, simply input a
username and sign up.

You will then be prompted to set up a Passkey and PIN password. Once this is complete, you will be able to 'Create
Session'. This enables all of the game functions in a transactionless session.
76.title: Using the Controller in Eternum

77.html: Transfer a season pass to your controller easily here. Connect your controller by selecting the controller icon located at the top of the page and select the passes to transfer.
77.text:
Transfer a season pass to your controller easily here. Connect your
controller by selecting the controller icon located at the top of the page and select the passes to transfer.
77.title: Transfer Season Pass to Controller

79.html:
• Passwordless authentication using Passkeys for one-click onboarding
  • Self-custodial embedded wallets that put players in control
  • Built-in security features to protect player assets
79.text:
Passwordless authentication using Passkeys for one-click onboarding
Self-custodial embedded wallets that put players in control
Built-in security features to protect player assets
79.title: Simple and Secure

80.html:
• Session keys eliminate transaction popups during gameplay
  • Secure transaction delegation lets games submit actions on behalf of players
  • Free transactions through the Cartridge Paymaster so players focus on playing

Should you have any issues with the controller or require support, you can join the Cartridge Discord here.

Session keys eliminate transaction popups during gameplay
Secure transaction delegation lets games submit actions on behalf of players
Free transactions through the Cartridge Paymaster so players focus on playing

Should you have any issues with the controller or require support, you can join the Cartridge Discord
here.
80.title: Designed for Seamless Gameplay:

83.html:
Realm holders enjoy exclusive benefits, including free entry into each new Season. Each Season Pass is unique to a Realm and grants access to the game. To use a season pass for game entry, players must transfer it to their Cartridge Wallet.

  • Mint your pass here
83.text:
Realm holders enjoy exclusive benefits, including free entry into each new Season. Each Season Pass is unique to a Realm
and grants access to the game. To use a season pass for game entry, players must transfer it to their Cartridge Wallet.

Mint your pass here
83.title: Realm Holder Entry

85.html: Should a Realm holder decide not to play with their Season Pass, they can transfer it or sell it on the Realms Marketplace allowing non-Realm holders to participate in the game.
85.text:
Should a Realm holder decide not to play with their Season Pass, they can transfer it or sell it on the
Realms Marketplace allowing non-Realm holders to participate in the game.
85.title: Marketplace

86.html:
⚠️ Coming Soon

Synthetic Realms will be introduced in future seasons.

This feature will not be available during Season 0.

During gameplay, Realm holders will have the opportunity to discover Synthetic Realms. These discovered Realms can then be auctioned using $LORDS, allowing non-Realm holders to participate in the game through temporary ownership for the current Season. Auction fees will be distributed through the game fee system.
86.text:
⚠️ Coming Soon
Synthetic Realms will be introduced in future seasons.
This feature will not be available during Season 0.

During gameplay, Realm holders will have the opportunity to discover Synthetic Realms. These discovered Realms can then
be auctioned using $LORDS, allowing non-Realm holders to participate in the game through temporary ownership for the
current Season. Auction fees will be distributed through the game fee system.
86.title: Synthetic Realms

87.html: As long as you maintain in-game Realm ownership, you can actively participate without additional entry fees. Engage in the market using $LORDS tokens and enjoy uninterrupted gameplay.
87.text:
As long as you maintain in-game Realm ownership, you can actively participate without additional entry fees. Engage in
the market using $LORDS tokens and enjoy uninterrupted gameplay.
87.title: Continuous Play

88.html:
⚔️ Takeover System

In-game Realms can be conquered within a Season, transferring control to the conqueror.

Gameplay rights are restored at the start of the next Season, ensuring a dynamic and competitive environment.
88.text:
⚔️ Takeover System
In-game Realms can be conquered within a Season, transferring control to the conqueror.
Gameplay rights are restored at the start of the next Season, ensuring a dynamic and competitive environment.
88.title: Realm Control Mechanics

89.html:
Eternum is more than just a game; it's a digital ecosystem that evolves with its players.

After two years of dedicated development, Eternum offers a unique blend of economic and social frameworks, creating a dynamic and immersive experience.
89.text:
Eternum is more than just a game; it's a digital ecosystem that evolves with its players.
After two years of dedicated development, Eternum offers a unique blend of economic and social frameworks, creating
a dynamic and immersive experience.
89.title: Introduction

91.html:
Eternum is built on three core pillars:

  • Player-Driven Economy: The economy is shaped by player actions, from resource production to market prices.
  • Strategic Depth: Master resource management, territorial control, and military prowess to succeed.
  • Community Governance: Form tribes, build alliances, and influence the political landscape.
91.text:
Eternum is built on three core pillars:

Player-Driven Economy: The economy is shaped by player actions, from resource production to market prices.
Strategic Depth: Master resource management, territorial control, and military prowess to succeed.
Community Governance: Form tribes, build alliances, and influence the political landscape.
91.title: Core Pillars

92.html: Eternum offers high-stakes gameplay across defined seasons, set on an infinite, procedurally generated hexagonal map. Players can pursue total victory or explore freely, with a focus on diplomacy, resource management, and tactical decisions.
92.text:
Eternum offers high-stakes gameplay across defined seasons, set on an infinite, procedurally generated hexagonal map.
Players can pursue total victory or explore freely, with a focus on diplomacy, resource management, and tactical
decisions.
92.title: Game Features

93.html:
• Early Game: Establish your Realm, build infrastructure, and secure resources.
  • Mid Game: Expand influence, forge alliances, and develop military capabilities.
  • End Game: Engage in epic battles, large-scale diplomacy, and resource warfare.
93.text:
Early Game: Establish your Realm, build infrastructure, and secure resources.
Mid Game: Expand influence, forge alliances, and develop military capabilities.
End Game: Engage in epic battles, large-scale diplomacy, and resource warfare.
93.title: Game Progression

94.html:
• Seasons: Compete through strategic paths with resources from previous seasons.
  • World Map: Navigate an infinite hexagonal grid with procedurally generated terrain.
  • Resources & Economy: Trade 22 different resource types in player-driven markets.
  • Military Power: Build armies, control territories, and engage in strategic warfare.
  • Social Structure: Form tribes, manage diplomatic relations, and create alliances.
94.text:
Seasons: Compete through strategic paths with resources from previous seasons.
World Map: Navigate an infinite hexagonal grid with procedurally generated terrain.
Resources & Economy: Trade 22 different resource types in player-driven markets.
Military Power: Build armies, control territories, and engage in strategic warfare.
Social Structure: Form tribes, manage diplomatic relations, and create alliances.
94.title: Core Elements

95.html: Eternum lays the foundation for future development with open architecture, community extensions, and a focus on innovation. It serves as a benchmark for onchain gaming capabilities.
95.text:
Eternum lays the foundation for future development with open architecture, community extensions, and a focus on
innovation. It serves as a benchmark for onchain gaming capabilities.
95.title: Eternum as a Platform

  • GitHub - Explore the code
  • Season Pass - Mint your season pass
  • Marketplace - Buy your own Realm NFT or Season Pass
  • Empires Bridge - Bridge your assets

  • Twitter - Follow the community

98.title: Community

99.html: Eternum utilizes a seasonal system to maintain a fresh and exciting metagame, leveraging its unique two-layer architecture to enable dynamic gameplay experiences.
99.text:
Eternum utilizes a seasonal system to maintain a fresh and exciting metagame, leveraging its unique two-layer
architecture to enable dynamic gameplay experiences.
99.title: Seasons

100.html:
Seasons in Eternum are distinct gameplay periods that operate under specific rules and logic while maintaining certain persistent elements (such as resources) across different seasons.

This system allows for regular refreshes of the game meta and introduction of new mechanics without completely resetting player progress.
100.text:
Seasons in Eternum are distinct gameplay periods that operate under specific rules and logic while maintaining certain
persistent elements (such as resources) across different seasons.
This system allows for regular refreshes of the game meta and introduction of new mechanics without completely resetting
player progress.
100.title: Overview

102.html:
• Each season runs with predefined rules and victory conditions
  • Concludes with a specific end state
  • Once concluded, no further actions can be taken in that season
102.text:
Each season runs with predefined rules and victory conditions
Concludes with a specific end state
Once concluded, no further actions can be taken in that season
102.title: Active Season

103.html:
During an active season, and UP TO 48 hours after season end, resources and $LORDS from your Realms can be bridged out of the game as ERC20 tokens. This allows these resources to be used in future seasons as well.

Bridging resources into and out of the game is done via the Central Bank, positioned in the center of the map. When bridging, distance and transport time calculations are computed for you.

Bridging resources incurs fees that are distributed to:

  • Central Bank: Fees are added to the Bank's treasury and can be claimed by the Bank's owner
  • Velords: Fees are contributed to the Lordship Protocol
  • Season Pool: Fees are added to the current Season's Prize Pool
  • Client: Fees are allocated to the game client being used
103.text:
During an active season, and UP TO 48 hours after season end, resources and $LORDS from your Realms can be
bridged out of the game as ERC20 tokens. This allows these resources to be used in future seasons as well.
Bridging resources into and out of the game is done via the Central Bank, positioned in the center of the map. When
bridging, distance and transport time calculations are computed for you.
Bridging resources incurs fees that are distributed to:

Central Bank: Fees are added to the Bank's treasury and can be claimed by the Bank's owner
Velords: Fees are contributed to the Lordship Protocol
Season Pool: Fees are added to the current Season's Prize Pool
Client: Fees are allocated to the game client being used
103.title: Resource bridge

104.html:
Between seasons, there is a cooldown period lasting several weeks that serves multiple purposes:

  • Implementation of new features
  • Patching of identified issues
  • Preparation for the upcoming season
  • Community feedback and adjustment period
104.text:
Between seasons, there is a cooldown period lasting several weeks that serves multiple purposes:

Implementation of new features
Patching of identified issues
Preparation for the upcoming season
Community feedback and adjustment period
104.title: Between Seasons

105.html:
While seasons introduce new mechanics and rules, certain elements persist across seasons:

  • Core resources
  • Player achievements
  • Other fundamental progression elements
105.text:
While seasons introduce new mechanics and rules, certain elements persist across seasons:

Core resources
Player achievements
Other fundamental progression elements
105.title: Persistence and Reset

106.html:
The seasonal structure enables developers to:

  • Fork the game to create parallel versions
  • Experiment with different gameplay mechanics
  • Create variations such as:
    • Low-cost variants of the world
    • Modified physics or rule sets
    • Experimental gameplay modes
106.text:
The seasonal structure enables developers to:

Fork the game to create parallel versions
Experiment with different gameplay mechanics
Create variations such as:

Low-cost variants of the world
Modified physics or rule sets
Experimental gameplay modes
106.title: Development Opportunities

107.html:
⚔️ Combat Advantages

The combat system features a strategic triangle of unit advantages:

  • Paladins excel against Crossbowmen
  • Crossbowmen dominate Knights
  • Knights overpower Paladins

Units deal +10% damage to their advantage target

Units receive -10% damage from their disadvantage unit
107.text:
⚔️ Combat Advantages
The combat system features a strategic triangle of unit advantages:

Paladins excel against Crossbowmen
Crossbowmen dominate Knights
Knights overpower Paladins


Units deal +10% damage to their advantage target
Units receive -10% damage from their disadvantage unit
107.title: Combat System

108.html: Combat duration scales dynamically with army sizes. Larger armies naturally result in longer engagements, while highly uneven matchups may resolve more quickly as the stronger force overwhelms their opponent. Battles can be simulated to determine durations.
108.text:
Combat duration scales dynamically with army sizes. Larger armies naturally result in longer engagements, while highly
uneven matchups may resolve more quickly as the stronger force overwhelms their opponent. Battles can be simulated to
determine durations.
108.title: Battle Duration

109.html:
Combat in Eternum is dynamic and fluid. Additional armies can reinforce either side during battle, and fighting continues until victory is achieved or retreat is called.

Retreating forces pay a steep price: deserting armies lose % of their troops during withdrawal.
109.text:
Combat in Eternum is dynamic and fluid. Additional armies can reinforce either side during battle, and fighting
continues until victory is achieved or retreat is called.
Retreating forces pay a steep price: deserting armies lose % of
their troops during withdrawal.
109.title: Battle Dynamics

110.html:
🏰 Siege System

When attacking a Realm or the Central Bank, combat begins with an 8 hour siege phase. During this time, defenders can:

  • Transfer resources in or out of the realm
  • Prepare defenses
  • Launch an early counterattack to break the siege

After the siege timer expires:

  • Combat automatically begins
  • The realm enters active attack status
  • All resource transfers are blocked
110.text:
🏰 Siege System

When attacking a Realm or the Central Bank, combat begins with an 8
hour siege phase. During this time, defenders can:

Transfer resources in or out of the realm
Prepare defenses
Launch an early counterattack to break the siege

After the siege timer expires:

Combat automatically begins
The realm enters active attack status
All resource transfers are blocked
110.title: Siege Mechanics

111.html: Raiding allows you to pillage resources and potentially damage enemy structures through quick, decisive strikes.
111.text: Raiding allows you to pillage resources and potentially damage enemy structures through quick, decisive strikes.
111.title: Raid & Pillage

112.html:
• Raids are executed instantly
  • Both attacking and defending armies suffer troop losses (maximum 10%)
  • Successfully stealing resources depends on luck
  • Your stamina is completely depleted after raiding
  • Higher stamina when raiding increases maximum potential resource theft
112.text:
Raids are executed instantly
Both attacking and defending armies suffer troop losses (maximum 10%)
Successfully stealing resources depends on luck
Your stamina is completely depleted after raiding
Higher stamina when raiding increases maximum potential resource theft
112.title: Resource Pillaging

113.html:
There's a chance to destroy one random building in the raided realm:

  • Lower probability in inner hexes
  • Higher probability in outer hexes
  • Can target:
    • Military buildings (reducing army capacity)
    • Production buildings (disrupting economy)
    • Storage buildings (limiting resource capacity)

⚠️ Warning:

Maintain adequate realm defense!

If all defending troops are eliminated during a raid, the attacking force can claim your realm.
113.text:
There's a chance to destroy one random building in the raided realm:

Lower probability in inner hexes
Higher probability in outer hexes
Can target:

Military buildings (reducing army capacity)
Production buildings (disrupting economy)
Storage buildings (limiting resource capacity)




⚠️ Warning:
Maintain adequate realm defense!
If all defending troops are eliminated during a raid, the attacking force can claim your realm.
113.title: Building Destruction

115.html:
Paladins

  • Larger energy pool for extended movement
  • Same energy regeneration rate as other units
  • Can cover more distance in a single move

Crossbowmen

  • Reduced food consumption (50% less)
  • More efficient for exploration and movement

Knights

  • Standard unit with baseline stats
115.text:
Paladins 

Larger energy pool for extended movement
Same energy regeneration rate as other units
Can cover more distance in a single move


Crossbowmen 

Reduced food consumption (50% less)
More efficient for exploration and movement


Knights 

Standard unit with baseline stats
115.title: Unit Advantages

116.html:
🏃 Movement Mechanics

  • Moving armies requires stamina
  • Each tile crossed consumes stamina
  • Food is consumed during movement

⚡ Stamina Mechanics

  • Army maximum stamina is determined by its composition
  • The unit with the lowest stamina pool sets the army limit
  • Regenerates 20 ⚡️ stamina every Eternum day.
  • Stamina is consumed when moving across tiles
116.text:
🏃 Movement Mechanics

Moving armies requires stamina
Each tile crossed consumes stamina
Food is consumed during movement

⚡ Stamina Mechanics

Army maximum stamina is determined by its composition
The unit with the lowest stamina pool sets the army limit
Regenerates 20 ⚡️ stamina every Eternum day.
Stamina is consumed when moving across tiles
116.title: Army Stamina System

117.html:
💨 Movement Traits

  • Paladins
    • Larger energy pool for extended movement
    • Takes longer to fully recharge stamina
  • Crossbowmen
    • Uses 50% less food while moving
    • Ideal for long-distance exploration
  • Knights
    • Standard movement costs
    • Standard food consumption
117.text:
💨 Movement Traits


Paladins

Larger energy pool for extended movement
Takes longer to fully recharge stamina



Crossbowmen

Uses 50% less food while moving
Ideal for long-distance exploration



Knights

Standard movement costs
Standard food consumption
117.title: Unit-Specific Movement

118.html:
🛡️ Defending Army

  • One defensive army can be created
  • Defends your realm from attacks
  • Can transfer military to an attacking army

⚔️ Attacking Army

  • Three attacking armies can be created to start but increases as realm upgrades
  • Explores map, can initiate battle and can join a side in an existing battle
  • Can only transfer military to armies on the same hex
  • Armies have limited storage and cannot move if storage is full, stamina is depleted or there is not enough food at the home realm
118.text:
🛡️ Defending Army

One defensive army can be created
Defends your realm from attacks
Can transfer military to an attacking army

⚔️ Attacking Army

Three attacking armies can be created to start but increases as realm upgrades
Explores map, can initiate battle and can join a side in an existing battle
Can only transfer military to armies on the same hex
Armies have limited storage and cannot move if storage is full, stamina is depleted or there is not enough food at the
home realm
118.title: Army Types

120.title: Wonders are exclusive structures within Eternum, with only 50 out of the 8,000 realms designated a Wonders.

122.html: • Wonders produce donkeys at 10% the Lords cost of a regular Realm at the same speed.
122.text: Wonders produce donkeys at 10% the Lords cost of a regular Realm at the same speed.
122.title: 🫏 Cheaper Donkeys
titles: Wonders are exclusive structures within Eternum, with only 50 out of the 8,000 realms designated a Wonders.

123.html: • Wonders start with three times the resources of a regular Realm, making them incredibly valuable at the very start of the Eternum journey.
123.text:
Wonders start with three times the resources of a regular Realm, making them incredibly valuable at the very start
of the Eternum journey.
123.title: 🔮 3x Starting Resources
titles: Wonders are exclusive structures within Eternum, with only 50 out of the 8,000 realms designated a Wonders.
